result.execSummary:
The defendant David J. Balcom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David J. Balcom is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David J. Balcom was found guilty of Resisting an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

5/11/16 - Sentencing Hearing on Revocation
2yrs WSP; initial confinement of 1yr followed by 1yr of ES.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Cassi Baumgardner.  Brief arguments heard.  Deft sentenced to 2yrs WSP; initial confinement of 1yr followed by 1yr of ES.  Credit for 97 days.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.  ES conditions to be identical to those of probation unless already satisfied.  An additional condition of ES - deft shall cooperate w/CSA.  Appeal rights.
Atty  C Baumgardner.

Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Aileen Henry.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Count 1 - Dismissed on State motion.  Count 2 - Plea of guilty as a repeater; found guilty by the Court.  Sentence withheld, placed on probation for 18 months w/conditions.  DNA collection ordered; def. given paperwork to take to KSD.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
